required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study to Develop a Group-Based E-Health Intervention for YA Cancer Survivors
clinical_study.official_title: Pilot Study to Develop a Group-Based E-Health Intervention for Young Adult Cancer Survivors

lead_sponsor.agency: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

clinical_study.source: H. Lee Moffitt Cancer Center and Research Institute

brief_summary.textblock: Investigators will test an evidence-based behavioral intervention that is responsive to Young Adults (YA's) expressed needs and priorities

primary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction assessed by study-specific survey during the intervention - Acceptability
primary_outcome.description: The intervention will be deemed acceptable if, on average, participants report satisfaction with the weekly sessions as ≥2 on a 0-4 scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction assessed by study-specific survey after the intervention - Acceptability
primary_outcome.description: The intervention will be deemed acceptable if, on average, participants report satisfaction with the overall program and intent to continue using the intervention skills as ≥2 on a 0-4 scale.

primary_outcome.measure: Session attendance after the intervention - Acceptability
primary_outcome.description: Videoconference delivery will be acceptable if average group attendance is ≥6/10 sessions.

secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete the 27-item Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - General

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in quality of life at after intervention
secondary_outcome.description: Participants will complete the 27-item Functional Assessment of Cancer Therapy - General

other_outcome.description: Participants will complete the 22-item Impact of Event Scale-Revised

other_outcome.measure: Change in Symptom burden after intervention
other_outcome.description: Participants will complete the 22-item Impact of Event Scale-Revised
Participants will complete the 22-item Impact of Event Scale-Revised

other_outcome.measure: Change in cancer-related distress after intervention
other_outcome.description: Participants will complete the 22-item Impact of Event Scale-Revised

other_outcome.measure: Stress management skills self-efficacy before intervention
other_outcome.description: Participants will complete subscales from the Measure of Current Status

other_outcome.measure: Change in stress management skills self-efficacy after intervention
other_outcome.description: Participants will complete subscales from the Measure of Current Status

arm_group.description: Weekly video conference groups led by a trained facilitator

intervention.intervention_name: Cognitive-Behavioral Stress Management and Health Education
intervention.description: Participants will attend group sessions with a trained facilitator held over videoconference. Sessions will each last 2 hours and will be held once weekly for 10 weeks. Sessions will include Cognitive-Behavioral Stress Management and health education content.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-39 years old
- Diagnosed with cancer between 18-39 years old
- Cancer diagnosis was non-metastatic
- Completed cancer treatment between 1 month and 5 years prior to enrollment, with the exception of ongoing hormone therapy
- No documented or observable psychiatric or neurological disorders that could interfere with participation (e.g., active psychosis, active substance abuse), as identified by the referring medical team, chart review, or screening
- Able to speak and read English
- Able to provide informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- Metastatic disease
- Continued cancer treatment
- Psychiatric or neurological disorders that could interfere with study participation
- Vulnerable populations will not be included
